data.title: Gloria Anne Marsh Palmer Obituary 2022
data.meta_description: Gloria Anne Marsh Palmer, 71, Indianapolis, went home to be with her Lord March 26, 2022. She was born in Fort Belvoir, VA to Louis Stanley and Elfriede Caroline (Schmitt) Marsh...
data.text:
Gloria Anne Marsh Palmer, 71, Indianapolis, went home to be with her Lord March 26, 2022. She was born in Fort Belvoir, VA to Louis Stanley and Elfriede Caroline (Schmitt) Marsh. Gloria was a graduate of Arlington High School. She began her career as a clerical typist at the Finance Center Building at Fort Benjamin Harrison. Throughout her career, Gloria managed and ran the Minton-Capehart Federal Building, the US Federal Courthouse Building, and the Finance Center at Fort Benjamin Harrison. She began her career as a secretary and ended her career running the entire Finance Building which was the same building where she humbly began as an entry level secretary years before. Gloriaâ€™s accolades and awards throughout her career are too numerous to count.

Gloria enjoyed camping, travelling, and motorcycle riding with her husband, Mike. She was an amateur HAM radio operator, KB9UNR. She fiercely loved her family and enjoyed spending quality time with them- filling the role of 2nd mom to her two nephews, Adam and Jared. Those who knew her, knew her dog, Harley, was her baby.

She was preceded in death by her parents, Louis and DeeDee Marsh of Indianapolis, Indiana.

Survivors include her husband of 23 years, Michael R. Palmer; one sister: Pam (Dan) Pepmeier of Carmel, Indiana, two nephews: Adam (Elizabeth) Pepmeier of Cincinnati, Ohio and Jared (Maggie) Pepmeier of Carmel, Indiana; and one great-nephew: Logan Pepmeier.

Memorial contributions may be made to the American Heart Association, 6500 Technology Center Dr Suite 100, Indianapolis, IN 46278 or by clicking here.

Visitation will be held Wednesday from 4-6pm at Flanner Buchanan-Oaklawn Memorial Gardens (Conner Suite), 9700 Allisonville Rd. Indianapolis. Funeral services will follow at 6pm. Online condolences may be shared www.flannerbuchanan.com.
